qas.question: What eventually led to the creation of the peasant/smerdy class?
When did wages on the manors develop?
What were the smerdy initially given in the Kievian law code?
What lead to the eventual destruction of the peasant/smerdy class?
Who were the free landed people that worked by labouring for wages?
Who was not given equality in the Kievian law code?
Who was theoretically not equal to the prince?
Who began to slowly gain their rights and become more equal in the eyes of the law?

context: The <a0_0><b3_0>change in political structure<b3_0/><a0_0/> led to the inevitable development of the peasant class or smerdy. The <b4_0>smerdy<b4_0/> were free un-landed people that found work by labouring for wages on the manors which began to develop around <a1_0>1031<a1_0/> as the verv' began to dominate socio-political structure. <b6_0><b7_0>The <b5_0>smerdy<b7_0/><b6_0/><b5_0/> were initially <a2_0>given equality<a2_0/> in the Kievian law code, they were theoretically equal to the prince, so they enjoyed as much freedom as can be expected of manual labourers. However, in the 13th century they began to slowly lose their rights and became less equal in the eyes of the law.
